result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph N Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph N Berry

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph N Berry in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Joseph N Berry in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   State advises the Court they have complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel, Sandra W. and defendant.  

Couynt 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 9 months at the House of Correction - straight time - consecutive to any other time - with 3 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments, DV surcharge and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) no contact with Sandra W. without the approval of the Court; 4) complete the Batterer's Intervention program; 5) mental health evaluation; 6) obtain/maintain employment; 7) take prescribed medications as prescribed and keep agent informed; 8) attend counseling as directed; 9) obtain GED or HSED; 10) no contact with firearms; 11) pay the supervision fees; 12) pay restitution of $250 to Sandra W. to be paid through the agent .

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant cannot possess firearms or ammunition;
- defendant to have no contact with Sandra W. during the entire length of the sentence.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping;

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief  received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Court denies defense motion for expungement.  Court does not set a review hearing.

Defendant Joseph N Berry in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Joseph N Berry in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 04.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 1 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 as charged in the Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Counts 2 & 3 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes.
Due to branch 4 in trial, case transferred to branch 44 for Plea Hearing.   mld
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 4.
Defendant Joseph N Berry in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph N Berry in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial:  Cases 2015CM581 and 2015CM826.  Upon review of the discovery, defense counsel can raise objection to the consolidation of cases, if needed.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 6-10-2015 at 8:30 am.  Global offer will remain open until 6-3-2015, per the State.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Jesse H. or Sandra W, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Joseph N Berry in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  
Defendant Joseph N Berry in custody.  
James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
